#define APS_DATA_EXTENDED_HEADER_LENGTH   2U

#define APS_MAX_INTERPAN_HEADER_LENGTH   (APS_COMMON_INTERPAN_FRAME_HEADER_LENGTH + MAC_MAX_INTERPAN_MPDU_UNSECURED_OVERHEAD)

 APS auxiliary header's size.

Detailed Description

Definitions of common APS layer's constants and types.

Author:
Microchip Corporation: http://www.microchip.com
Support email: support@microchip.com

Copyright (c) 2018, Microchip Corporation. All rights reserved. Licensed under Mirochip's Limited License Agreement.

Definition in file apsCommon.h.

Define Documentation

#define APS_COMMON_DATA_FRAME_HEADER_LENGTH   8U

Length of min APS header. This header includes the following fields:

  • frame control - 1 octet
  • destination endpoint - 1 octet
  • cluster identifier - 2 octets
  • profile identifier - 2 octets
  • source endpoint - 1 octet
  • APS counter - 1 octet

Definition at line 40 of file apsCommon.h.

#define APS_DATA_EXTENDED_HEADER_LENGTH   2U

Maximum length of APS extended header in data packets.

Definition at line 43 of file apsCommon.h.

#define APS_COMMON_INTERPAN_FRAME_HEADER_LENGTH   9U

Maximum length of InterPan frame header

Definition at line 49 of file apsCommon.h.

#define APS_MAX_INTERPAN_HEADER_LENGTH   (APS_COMMON_INTERPAN_FRAME_HEADER_LENGTH + MAC_MAX_INTERPAN_MPDU_UNSECURED_OVERHEAD)

Maximum header size for InterPan message

Definition at line 52 of file apsCommon.h.

#define APS_MIN_AUXILIARY_HEADER_LENGTH   6U

Minimum length of APS auxiliary header.

Definition at line 70 of file apsCommon.h.

#define APS_AUXILIARY_HEADER_LENGTH   (APS_MIN_AUXILIARY_HEADER_LENGTH + 8U)

APS auxiliary header's size.

See ZigBee spec. r18, 4.5.1.1, Security Control Field.

Definition at line 76 of file apsCommon.h.

#define APS_MAX_DATA_FRAME_HEADER_LENGTH   (APS_COMMON_DATA_FRAME_HEADER_LENGTH + APS_DATA_EXTENDED_HEADER_LENGTH + APS_AUXILIARY_HEADER_LENGTH)

Maximum APS header's size

Definition at line 79 of file apsCommon.h.

#define APS_MAX_DATA_FRAME_FOOTER_LENGTH   4U

Maximum APS footer's size: 4 bytes - Message Integrity Code (MIC)

Maximum length of APS data payload which can be sent.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum APS_AddrMode_t

APS addressing modes.

Defines APS addressing modes

Enumerator:
APS_NO_ADDRESS 

Indirect addressing mode via binding

APS_GROUP_ADDRESS 

Group addressing mode via multicasting

APS_SHORT_ADDRESS 

Unicast addressing mode, with a 16-bit network (short) address

APS_EXT_ADDRESS 

Unicast addressing mode, with a 64-bit IEEE (extended) address.

Definition at line 212 of file apsCommon.h.

enum APS_Status_t

APS status values.

APS status values used in most of standard primives.

Enumerator:
APS_SUCCESS_STATUS 

A request has been executed successfully.

APS_MAC_PAN_AT_CAPACITY_STATUS 

IEEE 802.15.4-2006, Table 83. Valid values of the Association Status field.

APS_INVALID_EP_STATUS 

The supplied endpoint was equal to 0x00 or 0xff.

APS_ASDU_TOO_LONG_STATUS 

A transmit request has failed since the ASDU is too large and fragmentation is not supported.

APS_DEFRAG_DEFERRED_STATUS 

A received fragmented frame can not be defragmented currently.

APS_DEFRAG_UNSUPPORTED_STATUS 

A received fragmented frame can not be defragmented, because the device does not support fragmentation.

APS_ILLEGAL_REQUEST_STATUS 

APS is in a state when request's execution is impossible.

APS_INVALID_BINDING_STATUS 

An APSME-UNBIND.request has failed, because the requested binding link does not exist in the binding table.

APS_INVALID_GROUP_STATUS 

An APSME-REMOVE-GROUP.request has been issued with a group identifier that is absent in the group table.

APS_INVALID_PARAMETER_STATUS 

A parameter's value is invalid or out of range.

APS_NO_ACK_STATUS 

An APSDE-DATA.request requesting acknowledged transmission has failed because of no acknowledgement being received.

APS_NO_BOUND_DEVICE_STATUS 

An APSDE-DATA.request with the destination addressing mode set to 0x00 has failed, because no devices are bound to this device.

APS_NO_SHORT_ADDRESS_STATUS 

An APSDE-DATA.request with the destination addressing mode set to 0x03 has failed, because the corresponding short address has not been found in the address map table.

APS_NOT_SUPPORTED_STATUS 

An APSDE-DATA.request with the destination addressing mode set to 0x00 has failed, because the binding table is not supported on the device.

APS_SECURED_LINK_KEY_STATUS 

An ASDU secured using a link key has been received .

APS_SECURED_NWK_KEY_STATUS 

An ASDU secured using a network key has been received.

APS_SECURITY_FAIL_STATUS 

An APSDE-DATA.request requesting security has resulted in an error during the corresponding security processing.

APS_TABLE_FULL_STATUS 

An APSME-BIND.request or APSME.ADDGROUP.request have been issued ,while the binding table or the group table, respectively, is full.

APS_UNSECURED_STATUS 

An unsecured ASDU has been received.

APS_UNSUPPORTED_ATTRIBUTE_STATUS 

An APSME-GET.request or APSMESET.request has been issued with an unknown attribute's identifier.

APS_SECURED_TRUST_CENTER_LINK_KEY_STATUS 

An ASDU secured using the trust center link key has been received.

APS_SECURED_HASH_OF_TRUST_CENTER_LINK_KEY_STATUS 

An ASDU secured using the trust center's link key's hash has been received.

APS_NWK_INVALID_PARAMETERS_STATUS 

An invalid or out-of-range parameter has been passed to a primitive from the next higher layer.

APS_NWK_INVALID_REQUEST_STATUS 

The next higher layer has issued a request that is invalid or cannot be executed given the current state of the NWK layer.

APS_NWK_NOT_PERMITTED_STATUS 

An NLME-JOIN.request has been disallowed.

APS_NWK_STARTUP_FAILURE_STATUS 

An NLME-NETWORK-FORMATION.request has failed to start a network.

APS_NWK_ALREADY_PRESENT_STATUS 

A device with the address supplied to the NLMEDIRECT-JOIN.request is already present in the neighbor table of the device on which the NLME-DIRECT-JOIN.request has been issued.

APS_NWK_SYNC_FAILURE_STATUS 

An NLME-SYNC.request has failed at the MAC layer.

APS_NWK_NEIGHBOR_TABLE_FULL_STATUS 

An NLME-JOIN-DIRECTLY.request has failed, because there the neighbor table is full.

APS_NWK_UNKNOWN_DEVICE_STATUS 

An NLME-LEAVE.request has failed, because the device addressed in the parameter list is not in the neighbor table of the issuing device.

APS_NWK_UNSUPPORTED_ATTRIBUTE_STATUS 

An NLME-GET.request or NLME-SET.request has been issued with an unknown attribute's identifier.

APS_NWK_NO_NETWORKS_STATUS 

No networks has been detected after an NLME-JOIN.request has been issued.

APS_NWK_MAX_FRM_COUNTER_STATUS 

Security processing has been attempted on an outgoing frame and has failed, because the frame counter has reached its maximum value.

APS_NWK_NO_KEY_STATUS 

Security processing has been attempted on an outgoing frame and has failed, because no key was available with which to process it.

APS_NWK_BAD_CCM_OUTPUT_STATUS 

Security processing has been attempted on an outgoing frame and has failed, because the security engine produced erroneous output.

APS_NWK_NO_ROUTING_CAPACITY_STATUS 

An attempt to discover a route has failed because of a lack of routing table's or discovery table's capacity.

APS_NWK_ROUTE_DISCOVERY_FAILED_STATUS 

An attempt to discover a route has failed owing to a reason other than a lack of routing tables' capacity.

APS_NWK_ROUTE_ERROR_STATUS 

An NLDE-DATA.request has failed due to a routing failure on the sending device.

APS_NWK_BT_TABLE_FULL_STATUS 

An attempt to send a broadcast frame or member mode multicast has failed, because there is no room in the broadcast transmission table.

APS_NWK_FRAME_NOT_BUFFERED_STATUS 

An NLDE-DATA.request has failed owing to a lack of buffered space.

APS_MAC_COUNTER_ERROR_STATUS 

IEEE 802.15.4-2006, Table 78 MAC enumerations description. The frame counter purportedly applied by the originator of the received frame is invalid.

APS_MAC_IMPROPER_KEY_TYPE_STATUS 

The key purportedly applied by the originator of the received frame is not allowed to be used with that frame type according to the key usage policy of the recipient.

APS_MAC_IMPROPER_SECURITY_LEVEL_STATUS 

The security level purportedly applied by the originator of the received frame does not meet the minimum security level required/expected by the recipient for that frame type.

APS_MAC_UNSUPPORTED_LEGACY_STATUS 

The received frame was purportedly secured using security based on IEEE Std 802.15.4-2003, though such security is not supported by this standard.

APS_MAC_UNSUPPORTED_SECURITY_STATUS 

The security purportedly applied by the originator of the received frame is not supported.

APS_MAC_BEACON_LOSS_STATUS 

The beacon was lost following a synchronization request.

APS_MAC_CHANNEL_ACCESS_FAILURE_STATUS 

A transmission could not take place due to activity on the channel, i.e., the CSMA-CA mechanism has failed.

APS_MAC_DENIED_STATUS 

The GTS request has been denied by the PAN coordinator.

APS_MAC_DISABLE_TRX_FAILURE_STATUS 

The attempt to disable the transceiver has failed.

APS_MAC_FRAME_TOO_LONG_STATUS 

Either a frame resulting from processing has a length that is greater than aMaxPHYPacketSize or a requested transaction is too large to fit in the CAP or GTS.

APS_MAC_INVALID_GTS_STATUS 

The requested GTS transmission has failed because the specified GTS either does not have a transmit GTS direction or has not been defined.

APS_MAC_INVALID_HANDLE_STATUS 

A request to purge an MSDU from the transaction queue was made using an MSDU handle that was not found in the transaction table.

APS_MAC_INVALID_PARAMETER_STATUS 

A parameter in the primitive is either not supported or is out of the valid range.

APS_MAC_NO_ACK_STATUS 

No acknowledgment was received after macMaxFrameRetries.

APS_MAC_NO_BEACON_STATUS 

A scan operation failed to find any network beacons.

APS_MAC_NO_DATA_STATUS 

No response data were available following a request.

APS_MAC_NO_SHORT_ADDRESS_STATUS 

The operation failed because a 16-bit short address was not allocated.

APS_MAC_OUT_OF_CAP_STATUS 

A receiver enable request was unsuccessful because it could not be completed within the CAP.

APS_MAC_PAN_ID_CONFLICT_STATUS 

A PAN identifier conflict has been detected and communicated to the PAN coordinator.

APS_MAC_REALIGNMENT_STATUS 

A coordinator realignment command has been received.

APS_MAC_TRANSACTION_EXPIRED_STATUS 

The transaction has expired and its information was discarded.

APS_MAC_TRANSACTION_OVERFLOW_STATUS 

There is no capacity to store the transaction.

APS_MAC_TX_ACTIVE_STATUS 

The transceiver was in the transmitter enabled state when the receiver was requested to be enabled.

APS_MAC_UNAVAILABLE_KEY_STATUS 

The key purportedly used by the originator of the received frame is not available or, if available, the originating device is not known or is blacklisted with that particular key.

APS_MAC_UNSUPPORTED_ATTRIBUTE_STATUS 

A SET/GET request was issued with the identifier of a PIB attribute that is not supported.

APS_MAC_INVALID_ADDRESS_STATUS 

A request to send data was unsuccessful because neither the source address parameters nor the destination address parameters were present.

APS_MAC_ON_TIME_TOO_LONG_STATUS 

A receiver enable request was unsuccessful because it specified a number of symbols that was longer than the beacon interval.

APS_MAC_PAST_TIME_STATUS 

A receiver enable request was unsuccessful because it could not be completed within the current superframe and was not permitted to be deferred until the next superframe.

APS_MAC_TRACKING_OFF_STATUS 

The device was instructed to start sending beacons based on the timing of the beacon transmissions of its coordinator, but the device is not currently tracking the beacon of its coordinator.

APS_MAC_INVALID_INDEX_STATUS 

An attempt to write to a MAC PIB attribute that is in a table failed because the specified table index was out of range.

APS_MAC_LIMIT_REACHED_STATUS 

There are some unscanned channels yet, but there is no memory

APS_MAC_READ_ONLY_STATUS 

A SET/GET request was issued with the identifier of an attribute that is read only.

APS_MAC_SCAN_IN_PROGRESS_STATUS 

A request to perform a scan operation failed because the MLME was in the process of performing a previously initiated scan operation.

APS_MAC_SUPERFRAME_OVERLAP_STATUS 

The device was instructed to start sending beacons based on the timing of the beacon transmissions of its coordinator, but the instructed start time overlapped the transmission time of the beacon of its coordinator.

Definition at line 229 of file apsCommon.h.
